aboutData.title: About Me
aboutData.description: Julia Kan (b. 1999) is a Brazilian visual artist based in Salvador, Bahia. Her artistic practice is primarily lens-based but is profoundly informed by her background in spatial design, creating a dialogue between photography and scenography. She holds a Bachelor's degree in Performing Arts – Scenography from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) and is currently a Master's student in the Visual Arts Graduate Program at the Federal University of Bahia (UFBA). Her work is rooted in an investigation of spatiality, perception, and the transformative dialogue between the two-dimensional image and the three-dimensional object. Since 2021, she has worked professionally as a scenographer and production designer for film, theatre, and exhibitions.
